availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: State of Kentucky Logan County Sct It being represented to us the undersigned Justice of the peace for Logan County Ky That John. W. Malone has removed from the state and his office as Presiding Judge of the county is Vacant In pursuance with the law in such cases made and provided The clerk of the Logan County in pursuance as aforesaid notified us of the same And we the undersigned Convened at the courthouse in Russellville Kentucky on this day It being the named by said clerk for us to Convene And we proceeded to fill said Vacancy Whereupon Aaron D. Kennedy was unanimously elected to fill said Vacancy. Given under our hands this 24th day of February 1862.

Dillard Duncan J. P.
Benoni Swearingen J. P.
B. G. Williams
J. R. Smith J. P
W. W. Smith J P
A. B. Smith J P
John. W. Hogan J P
C. T. Williams J. P
C. F James. J. P
C. H. Blakey J P
J. A. McReynolds J P.

It is ordered by the court that Thomas B Harrison & James E. Wright or either one of them be & they are hereby appointed a Committee to deliver a Copy of the foregoing To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of the State of Kentucky at Franfort Kentucky without delay.
A copy attest James E. Wright clerk of the Logan County Court State of Kentucky

Logan Co
Election of A. D. Kennedy
Pr. Judge
Comd. Mar. 1. 1862
